page.title: 13 LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Our best claim to fame lies in our rich history. The Prehistoric Cotswold Ridgeway crosses our D-Block. We have evidence of Neolithic and Roman finds here. Our name Sapperton is thought to be 'Sapere-tun', Anglo Saxon for 'Homestead of the soap makers'.We are mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086 and Charles 1 slept at the home of Sir Henry Poole in Sapperton in 1644. The longest Canal Tunnel (at that time) was cut through the hill in 1784 and was followed in 1845 by a Railway Tunnel. Throughout time we have attracted visitors, our most recent group being the followers of William Morris who became known as the 'School of Sapperton Craftsmen' and who built many beautifully integrated houses here.
